summary: This is an email from Audrey Strauss, the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, regarding negotiations with defense attorneys for an individual (name redacted) in the Epstein case. The email indicates an impasse and forwards defense submissions and a team memo for discussion of next steps.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Sender of the email, U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, discussing negotiations with defense attorneys.

persons.name: Ilan Graff
persons.context: Recipient of the email, part of the U.S. Attorney's Office team handling the case.

persons.name: Rebekah Donaleski
persons.context: Copied on the email, part of the U.S. Attorney's Office team.

connections.description: Both are prosecutors in the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, working on the same case.
Both are prosecutors in the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, copied on the same case email.

events.title: Negotiation Impasse with Defense
events.description: Discussions between the U.S. Attorney's Office and defense attorneys for a redacted individual have reached an impasse.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office, led by Audrey Strauss, was engaged in negotiations with defense attorneys for an individual (name redacted) in the Epstein case.
As of January 8, 2021, those negotiations had reached an impasse.
The email forwards the full collection of defense submissions received to date and a team memo regarding a specific file (EFTA00102017) to facilitate discussion of next steps.
Multiple Assistant U.S. Attorneys (Ilan Graff, Rebekah Donaleski, and others with redacted names) are involved in the case.
The subject individual's name and their attorneys' names are redacted in the provided text.
